Package frogger.controller

Class ScoreBoardController

  • java.lang.Object
    • frogger.controller.ScoreBoardController
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ScoreBoardScene
    public class ScoreBoardController
extends java.lang.Object
    scoreBoardController class is used to control high score board shown. Before high score board is displayed, player will enter their name in the textfield. The interface moves on to final high score board showing player's score after pressing submit button.
    Author:
    scytl2, 20027098

    • Method Detail

      • buttonController

        public void buttonController​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Uses button ActionEvent to control triggering the event. If user enters any input in the textfield, the user input will be saved into playerName String variable and stored into an array list in the inputPlayerList declared variable. Eventually, stored in player named text file. else the output will print out the message of "No player's name entered" As BufferedReader finishes its task of reading user's input Subsequently, it will open up high score board via scoreBoardShow variable
        Parameters:
        event - is used to identify button trigger
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an input or output exception occurred

      • getPlayerName

        public java.lang.String getPlayerName()
        getPlayerName is used to obtain player's name in different class
        Returns:
        the player's name
